name: Cahinca
Relationship: Compare: Apocyn.; Ars.; Coffea (similar botanically and in relieving effects of fatigue).

Back: Pain in region of kidneys; better lying bent backward
Male: Pain worse during passage of pungent smelling urine
Drawing in of testicles and spermatic cord

details: Urinary Organs.Constant desire to urinate. Polyuria while traveling. Urine fiery. Burning pain in urethra, especially glandular portion.This remedy has been found of use in dropsical affections. Its urinary symptoms are well marked. Albuminuria, with dyspnoea on lying down at night. Ascites and anasarca, with dry skin.
